> I should have qualified that further to be writing tests first _and_ removing
> all duplication.

How do you know that you removed all duplication?  Do you have some 
tests that can prove it?

I agree that when you :
- start a brand new project
- don't have any buggy untested legacy code
- strictly use test-first for every functionality
- don't make any mistake in code you think can't break
- perfectly master refactoring
- each member of your team share the same level of competence and dedication

you can test all paths of your application.  I have two remarks:
1) so many Ifs leave plenty of room for mistakes
2) having tests for a path does not guarantee that the path will not 
have bugs. (100% code coverage != 100% bug free)

-Vladimir
